C

column - Variable in class io.raffi.JSON.Token
This internal data member saves the column number from the original source data where the token has started.

This method returns a JSONArray if in fact the data type of the internally saved object is an instance of JSONArray.

J

JSONArray - Class in io.raffi.JSON
This class extends the ArrayList container class and it wraps it using the JSONData object.
JSONArray() - Constructor for class io.raffi.JSON.JSONArray
This constructor simply calls the super constructor since this class is a wrapper class around the ArrayList container.
JSONData - Class in io.raffi.JSON
This class is very important, because it wraps the JSON data into it.
JSONData(Boolean) - Constructor for class io.raffi.JSON.JSONData
This is an overloaded constructor that has a different data type that is passed that is different from all the other constructors.

This is an overloaded constructor that has a different data type that is passed that is different from all the other constructors.

JSONData.Type - Enum in io.raffi.JSON
This enumerated type specifies the type of data that is passed in the constructor.
JSONException - Exception in io.raffi.JSON
This class extends the RuntimeException thrown-able and it simply halts program execution when a an error occurs and we throw it while in the Lexer or the Parser.
JSONException(String) - Constructor for exception io.raffi.JSON.JSONException
This constructor takes a error message and prints it out, if its a mac, print color header.
JSONObject - Class in io.raffi.JSON
This class extends the HashMap container class and it is a wrapper around it using the JSONData class.
JSONObject() - Constructor for class io.raffi.JSON.JSONObject
Since this class wraps the HashMap class, it will simply call the super constructor.

L

Lexer - Class in io.raffi.JSON
This class is the Lexer class and is initialized with either a JSON string, JSON file, or JSON input stream.
Lexer(String) - Constructor for class io.raffi.JSON.Lexer
This constructor takes in a JSON data string and saves the data internally, saves the data length, and initialized the positional data members.
Lexer(File) - Constructor for class io.raffi.JSON.Lexer
This constructor takes in a JSON data file and saves the data internally, saves the data length, and initialized the positional data members.
Lexer(InputStream) - Constructor for class io.raffi.JSON.Lexer
This constructor takes in a JSON data input stream and saves the data internally, saves the data length, and initialized the positional data members.
line - Variable in class io.raffi.JSON.Token
This internal data member saves the line number from the original source data where the token has started.

N

nextToken() - Method in class io.raffi.JSON.Lexer
This method returns the next token that is encountered in the data stream that we got passed in the constructor.

P

Parser - Class in io.raffi.JSON
This class is the Parser class and it initialized the Lexer using whatever constructor we choose, then it parsed the data and traversed through the below defined CFG in order to parse and validate the json data.
Parser(File) - Constructor for class io.raffi.JSON.Parser
This constructor is initialized with passing the file object.
Parser(String) - Constructor for class io.raffi.JSON.Parser
This constructor is initialized with passing a data string to it.
Parser(InputStream) - Constructor for class io.raffi.JSON.Parser
This constructor is initialized with passing an input stream.

S

SyntacticError - Exception in io.raffi.JSON
This class extends the RuntimeException thrown-able and it simply halts program execution when a syntax error occurred.
SyntacticError(String, int, int) - Constructor for exception io.raffi.JSON.SyntacticError
This constructor takes in a error message and the line and column that the error occurred on.

T

Token - Class in io.raffi.JSON
This class is essentially a data wrapper and stores different types of data that make up a token.
Token(Token.Type, String, int, int) - Constructor for class io.raffi.JSON.Token
This constructor simply takes in the type of token, value, and the line and column that the token appears in.
Token.Type - Enum in io.raffi.JSON
This enum class specifies the token type.
toString() - Method in class io.raffi.JSON.JSONArray
This function, simply traversed the array list and calls the toString method recursively on the JSONData object, and concatenated it together and wraps the JSON array syntax around the data.
toString() - Method in class io.raffi.JSON.JSONData
This method turns the data type that is saved internally into a string representation.
toString() - Method in class io.raffi.JSON.JSONObject
This function, simply traversed the hash map and calls the toString method recursively on the JSONData object, and concatenated it together and wraps the JSON object syntax around the data.
type - Variable in class io.raffi.JSON.JSONData
This data member contains the type of the saved data object.
type - Variable in class io.raffi.JSON.Token
This internal data member holds a member of the enumerated class that denotes the type of token that we are referencing in the instance.

V

value - Variable in class io.raffi.JSON.Token
This internal data member holds the value of the token as a string.

Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name.
valueOf(String) - Static method in enum io.raffi.JSON.Token.Type
Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name.
values() - Static method in enum io.raffi.JSON.JSONData.Type
Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared.
values() - Static method in enum io.raffi.JSON.Token.Type
Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared.
